job.title: Senior Smart Contract Engineer for Starknet (100% remote)
job.description:
About us

We are a Maker Core Unit (Starknet Engineering Core Unit) finance 50/50 by Maker and Starknet. We are a small team of 3 members (one Facilitator, 2 Engineers). Our Core Unit was ratified in September 2021.  Our ultimate mandate is to rebuild Maker onto Starknet. In phase I we built a simple bridge between Maker and Starknet. Phase II will start in January and will implement the wormhole design aiming at making DAI the easiest stablecoin to move around the ecosystem.

About Maker and Starknet

Maker is one of the biggest and most established DeFi protocol with ~$20Bn of value locked. Starknet is the zk-rollup by Starkware that just launched the alpha of its mainnet. Starkware is a $2bn company and their previous scalability solution (Starkex) is used by dYdX, Deversifi, ImmutableX, and Sorare.


References:

  • Wormhole design
  • Starknet implementation details

Requirements:

About the position in the next 6 months
We will be implementing the Starknet version of the DAI wormhole. It will involve:

  • develop the wormhole oracle on Starknet (providing mint attestation)
  • update our L1 and L2 bridge contracts with wormhole -specific functions
  • develop the Maker core module other related Maker contracts (see Maker documentation)
  • build unit tests and end-to-end tests working across L1, Starknet, and other rollup
About the position in the next 12 months

We will be implementing multi-collateral DAI on Starknet. It will involve:

  • develop the liquidation module
  • develop the price oracle module 
  • develop emergency shutdown
  • develop the system stabilizer module

Expectations

  • Contribute to design discussion
  • Find pragmatic solutions to hard technical challenges
  • Understand trust assumptions and ability to identify attack vectors
  • Technical leader with strong smart contract development background


About you.

Our ideal candidate:

  • has an extensive experience in back-end software engineering;
  • has experience building on Layer-2 scaling solutions, and its associated challenges (bridges, oracles, data availability, finality etc...);
  • has experience developing Solidity smart contract and protocols. Has developed smart contracts that were pushed onto Mainnet;
  • is a team player, has mentored Engineers; and
  • is eager to learn Cairo (Starknet language) and has some experience with zk-proofs

Practical aspects and compensation

  • We are a small team, financed by both Starkware and Maker
  • This position requires at least a 12 months commitment. Opportunity to continue with the core unit, or work for Maker, or work for Starkware afterwards
  • Competitive salary, can be in DAI or FIAT
  • Maker bonus

job.description:
About Kraken

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade, Kraken has risen to become one of the largest, most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet. 

We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank, providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter. 

Our diverse group of 2,000+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture, united by a shared passion for delighting customers, upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve, are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential. 

Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and we’re just getting started. We’re growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution!

About the Role

This is a fully remote role. 

Given our explosive growth and the incredible opportunity in front of us, we are working to innovate across all aspects of the company and execute on our highly ambitious plans.

The Business Operations team works closely with all functional areas of the company to improve Kraken’s effectiveness and efficiency. The team acts as a thought partner to leadership across the company, helping them understand and improve operational processes.  

On a daily basis, the team delivers actionable data-driven insights and recommendations that helps the company stay organized and coordinated.

  • Make recommendations for activities to improve processes and programs, including suggestions to increase efficiency, based on metrics and analysis
  • Bring structure and clarity to complex, often ambiguous operational issues
  • Support the execution of cross-functional, strategic initiatives
  • Cultivate a deep understanding of what makes Kraken tick
  • Provide feedback and make recommendations to management on project requirements and approach
  • Develop, communicate, and execute plans to enhance Kraken’s effectiveness

  • Consistent track record of performing data analysis

  • A proactive communicator with excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
  • Ability to balance competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong sense of urgency in driving projects to completion
  • Proactive team member with an entrepreneurial mindset, excellent attention to detail, and follow through
  • Strong interest in and familiarity with both cryptocurrency and traditional financial industries
  • Passion to do whatever it takes to solve complex problems and build scalable processes

job.title: Senior Software Engineer // Head of DeFi
Sr. Product Marketing Manager - Strategy + Research
Product Marketing Manager, Wallet & Dapps
Principal Cryptographer
job.description:
About Spring Labs:
Spring Labs is redefining how data is exchanged for the new age of data sharing, security, and consumer privacy through decentralization. Our Spring Protocol Tech Stack, which includes the use of Blockchain and Cryptography, allows institutions to share information among themselves to verify identities and reduce fraud - all while protecting consumer data.

Working at Spring Labs is about being part of a collaborative team, comprised of some of the most talented people in the industry. You would be welcomed into a fun, inclusive environment where we care as much about our employees as we do about our product. 


At Spring Labs, we build cutting-edge privacy tech for enterprise data exchange and analysis with a strong focus on commercial viability. We are hiring an experienced cryptographer to join our Research team to design the next evolution of these systems.

This role will be responsible for the design and specification of next-generation systems leveraging partial, somewhat, and fully homomorphic encryption. You will interact closely with the Software Engineering and Product teams to ensure our newest products are effective, usable, performant, and scalable.

Spring Labs is an in-office culture (partial remote work during Covid-19) that fosters a highly creative and collaborative work environment, however, full-remote is acceptable for this role for the right candidate.

If you are motivated by solving real-world problems with an extremely talented, accomplished team and want to work alongside veteran cryptographers and world-class engineers, we want to hear from you.

What you'll do
  • Design secure, novel, performant systems using cutting edge cryptography.
  • Author specifications, patents, and papers detailing the systems and techniques that will underpin our next generation of products.
  • Communicate complex designs to engineers and support them in the implementation.
  • Educate technical and non-technical stakeholders on our tools and technologies.

    • About you
  • Ph.D. – Cryptography, Math, Computer Science, Engineering, or related disciplines.
  • Strong background in the design and evaluation of cryptographic primitives and protocols.
  • Preferably-extensive experience in (partial, somewhat, leveled, fully) homomorphic encryption schemes and underlying structures such as lattices, and their optimizations.
  • Robust interest in pursuing research in and architecture of systems-level applications of cryptography, such as pertaining to practical utilization of homomorphic encryption (including threshold and multi-key variants), oblivious transfer, secure multiparty computation, proxy re-encryption, privacy-preserving entity resolution, private information retrieval, and functional encryption -- as well as the relevant interrelationships among these methods.
  • Genuine desire to maximize team output, such as to exercise an established capability to (independently and effectively) cryptanalyze the contributions of others.
  • Ability to implement prototypes and working knowledge of cryptographic libraries a plusMotivated by a fast-paced, proactive team environment.
  • Strong creative problem-solving skills.
  • Thrives in a highly collaborative environment.
  • Values and produces high-quality documentation.
  • Enjoys learning and teaching others.
    • Equal Opportunity Statement:
    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job.title: UX Product Designer
Scrum Master - Ledger Live
job.description:
Founded in 2014, Ledger is the leader in security and infrastructure solutions for cryptocurrencies and blockchain applications. 

Headquartered in Paris, with offices in Vierzon, Grenoble, Montpellier, Singapour and New York, Ledger has a team of 300+ professionals developing a variety of products and services to safeguard and protect crypto-assets for individuals and companies – including the Ledger Nano S and Ledger Nano X already sold at more than 3 million units in 190+ countries. 

Ledger Live is a wallet desktop and mobile application that provides a unique interface to maintain multiple cryptocurrencies for the Ledger Nano S / X. It lets users manage their devices, create accounts, receive and send cryptoassets, stake them …

Responsibilities
  • Exhibit lean agile leadership
  • Support the team to follow the defined rules of the agile team and where necessary, enforce them.
  • Facilitate scrum events such as daily stand-ups, sprint planning, sprint review and sprint retrospective
  • Helps the team remove impediments
  • Coach team members in Agile frameworks
  • Facilitate internal communication and effective collaboration
  • Be the point of contact for external communications (e.g. from customers or stakeholders)
  • Work with product owners to manage the backlog and new requests
  • Resolve conflicts and remove obstacles that occur
  • Help teams implement changes effectively
  • Ensure deliverables are up to quality standards at the end of each sprint
  • Guide development teams to higher scrum maturity
  • Measure and maintain a team’s velocity and manage clear sizing of the backlog

    • Requirements
  • 5+ Years of experience in a Scrum Master role
  • Familiarity with software development 
  • Excellent knowledge of Scrum techniques and artifacts (such as definition of done, user stories, backlog refinement)
  • Good knowledge of other Agile frameworks (Kanban, XP, etc.)
  • Realworld experience working in a multi-team environment with scaled scrum (SAFe, LESS, Scrum at Scale)
  • Excellent communication and servant leadership skills
  • Problem-solving and conflict-resolution ability
  • Outstanding organizational skills
  • Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or similar field
  • Scrum Master certification is an advantage

    • Benefits
  • Competitive compensation package and ESOP according to the Company policy
  • Strong focus on personal development including internal/external trainings and attendance to conferences
  • Internal talks, technical meetups and hackathons
  • Flexible working hours, remote-friendly environment
  • 5 weeks of paid vacation + 10 days of RTT
  • High performance office equipment
  • Comprehensive health insurance policy offering extensive medical, dental and vision care coverage
  • Meal Vouchers with Swile
  • Reimbursement for sports and cultural activities
  • Annual company outing for Ledgerdary Days plus infrequent parties, snacks and drinks
  • Employee discount on Ledger products
